title: Part G
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Greater than. Since L has a greater atomic mass than E, then L must also have a higher atomic number with its valence electrons occupying a higher-level shell. Electrons occupying a higher shell are, on average, further from the nucleus and thus result in a greater atomic radius.

The response provides both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Greater than. Since L has a greater atomic mass than E, then L must also have a higher atomic number with its valence electrons occupying a higher-level shell. Electrons occupying a higher shell are, on average, further from the nucleus and thus result in a greater atomic radius.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Greater than. According to Coulomb’s law, the strength of interaction between two ions is inversely proportional to the distance between their centers.
